title: RC circuits - compare tau for circuits X and Y

content.question: Circuits <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, shown in the figure, have identical batteries, capacitors, resistors, and switches. However, Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> contains two resistors while Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> only contains one resistor. What is the ratio <math alttext="tau sub X, to tau sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> between the time constant <math alttext="tau sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> of Circuit <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and the time constant <math alttext="tau sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>τ</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> of Circuit <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
